event.title: Webinar: Free Software and Open Educational Resources in Schools – Let's talk? (online)

body.p: Open Education Italia is organizing a webinar to explore the opportunities offered by Free Software and open educational resources in the school context. This event provides teachers, educators, and school leaders with a chance to discuss tools, best practices, and strategies for integrating open solutions into teaching, fostering more accessible, collaborative, and sustainable education.
During the session, two industry experts will share experiences and real-world case studies:

> Marta Andreoli, Deputy Coordinator Italy, will present the foundation’s mission and key campaigns, showcasing examples of schools that have adopted free software to enhance the educational experience.
> Antonio Faccioli (Fondazione Edulife), a STEM educator and trainer, as well as the scientific director of IT vocational training projects at Fondazione Edulife ETS, will discuss the foundation’s experiences with free software and open educational resources, with a special focus on STEM labs for schools.
